title: Version 7 production promotion notes and post-deploy smoke checks (frontend)

requirements.summary: Add frontend-facing release notes/checklist and remove basepath-sensitive navigation issues to support promoting Version 7 to production.
acceptanceCriteria: Version 7 is live and publicly accessible without deployment errors.
The live deployment serves the latest frontend and backend canister code for Version 7.

file_operations.description: Create a concise production promotion checklist for Version 7 focused on frontend readiness/verification (built assets, BASE_URL/basepath considerations, Internet Identity alternative origins file presence, and generated asset references).
Replace the hard-coded anchor navigation to "/admissions" with router-based navigation (e.g., TanStack Router) so the link works correctly when hosted under a non-root basepath in production.

requirements.summary: Add a repeatable frontend smoke-test checklist and lightweight test hooks to validate public browsing, admissions submission confirmation, and Internet Identity/admin-route protection after deploy.
acceptanceCriteria: Public pages load successfully: Home (/), Articles (/articles), Courses & Exams (/courses-exams), YouTube (/youtube), Contact (/contact).
Submitting the Admissions form (/admissions) succeeds and shows the confirmation/success state.
Internet Identity login works end-to-end and admin routes remain protected (e.g., /admin, /admin/articles, /admin/admissions).

file_operations.description: Create a post-deploy smoke test checklist for the live environment covering: loading each required public route; validating admissions submission and confirmation state; verifying Internet Identity login/logout; and confirming admin routes are protected. Use the authorization component expectations (Internet Identity + role-based admin gating) as the basis for the checks. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add stable, non-visual test hooks (e.g., data-testid attributes) for key admissions smoke-test elements: form container, submit button, and success/confirmation state, ensuring the live smoke test can reliably confirm the success state without changing UX.

Add stable, non-visual test hooks (e.g., data-testid) to support verifying Internet Identity login/logout in smoke tests. This aligns with the authorization component’s login/logout flow; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add stable, non-visual test hooks (e.g., data-testid) for the guard states (loading, login-required prompt, access-denied) to support validating admin-only access control in smoke tests. Use the authorization component’s RBAC expectations (admin-only) as reference; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
